headline: 'I Don't Have Hundreds Of Thousands Of Dollars,' Says Elon Musk's 21-Year-Old Daughter Who Lives With Roommates To Save On Rent
summary: Vivian Wilson, daughter of Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk, said she lives with three roommates in Los Angeles because it is "cheaper" and she often worries about money. "People assume I have a lot of money. I don't have hundreds of thousands of dollars at my disposal," the 21-year-old told New York magazine recently. Despite being the oldest of Musk's 14 children, Wilson said she does not benefit financially from his fortune and is working to build her own path. Don't Miss: Kevin O'Leary

headline: Fmr. OpenAI Exec: Competitive Landscape Moving Quickly
summary: Microsoft Corp. will start using artificial intelligence models from Anthropic to help power its workplace AI assistant, adding a significant partner to a product that has so far been predominantly driven by OpenAI. This comes as Nvidia gets set to invest as much as $100 billion in OpenAI to help the ChatGPT maker support a massive build-out of data centers equipped with Nvidia's chips. Former OpenAI Global Affairs Head of Strategic Partnerships Lane Dilg joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Live' at the Bloomberg Philanthropies Global Forum to discuss global artificial intelligence competition.

raw.headline: Fmr. OpenAI Exec: Competitive Landscape Moving Quickly
raw.summary: Microsoft Corp. will start using artificial intelligence models from Anthropic to help power its workplace AI assistant, adding a significant partner to a product that has so far been predominantly driven by OpenAI. This comes as Nvidia gets set to invest as much as $100 billion in OpenAI to help the ChatGPT maker support a massive build-out of data centers equipped with Nvidia's chips. Former OpenAI Global Affairs Head of Strategic Partnerships Lane Dilg joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Live' at the Bloomberg Philanthropies Global Forum to discuss global artificial intelligence competition.

headline: Tech Forum 2025: ASICs, packaging, and HBM reshape the AI chip race
summary: The global market for high-end cloud AI accelerators is approaching a major turning point. DIGITIMES forecasts that beginning in 2026, the supply chain will enter a new "decentralized" phase shaped by three forces: the expansion of custom ASICs, diversification of advanced packaging, and intensifying competition in high-bandwidth memory (HBM) pricing.

headline: Rattled by Trump's Chaotic H-1B Policy, US Firms Quietly Wait Out Changes
summary: The White House’s announcement Sept. 19 of a $100,000 fee sparked panic among employers and workers, particularly in the tech sector, which uses it to bring in trained engineers and programmers.  The initial frenzy has eased after officials clarified the fee wouldn’t apply to existing visa holders or renewals.  For businesses, one advantage of the wait-and-see approach is to avoid drawing the ire of the Trump administration, said Kathryn Wylde, chief executive officer of the Partnership for New York City.

raw.headline: Rattled by Trump's Chaotic H-1B Policy, US Firms Quietly Wait Out Changes
raw.summary: The White House’s announcement Sept. 19 of a $100,000 fee sparked panic among employers and workers, particularly in the tech sector, which uses it to bring in trained engineers and programmers.  The initial frenzy has eased after officials clarified the fee wouldn’t apply to existing visa holders or renewals.  For businesses, one advantage of the wait-and-see approach is to avoid drawing the ire of the Trump administration, said Kathryn Wylde, chief executive officer of the Partnership for New York City.

headline: Are Nvidia, Oracle mega-deals signs of an AI bubble forming?
summary: While US stocks (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC) are lifted in another AI-fueled rally tied to Nvidia's (NVDA) and Oracle's (ORCL) latest headlines, could a bubble be starting to form around markets? Crossmark Global Investments chief market strategist Victoria Fernandez and Yahoo Finance senior reporters Brooke DiPalma and Ines Ferré assess the market conditions that could be signaling a bubble. Also catch Asterozoa Capital's Joe Hegener illustrate whether investors are pouring "gasoline on the fire" as an AI-driven bubble could be forming around markets. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Powell Sees Stocks As Expensive. That’s Not His Problem.
summary: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell has a problem—but he doesn’t have the same problem that investors do.  Powell’s hands are full with the task of navigating the world’s biggest economy—which is a thicket of risks tied to tariffs, inflation, a weakening labor market, and unprecedented political pressure.  The Fed chair called it a “challenging situation” during a speech in Providence, R.I., on Tuesday.

headline: Is an AI bubble forming? We could be pouring gas 'on the fire.'
summary: While more tech giants invest heavily into artificial intelligence — Nvidia's (NVDA) multibillion-dollar investments in Intel (INTC) and OpenAI, Alibaba (BABA) raising its AI spending past $50 billion — is an AI bubble starting to form around markets (^DJI, ^IXIC, ^GSPC)? Asterozoa Capital CIO Joe Hegener sits down with Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to analyze whether a bubble could be forming around equity markets, driven by AI and the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Nvidia Expands Playbook With $100 Billion OpenAI Deal
summary: Nvidia  has the hottest product in the world’s biggest investment boom.  CEO Jensen Huang, meanwhile, has spoken about “insane” AI demand dynamics, a “new industrial revolution,” and the potential of an “infinite” need for computing power.  Nvidia  entered a $100 billion financing arrangement with OpenAI on Monday that reportedly will see the ChatGPT creator, which has yet to turn a profit, cede an equity stake to Nvidia as it builds out its data center capacity.
